TopicTitle: These kerbals will not come back soon....

Articles.Content:
So,in an attempt to get to the mun,i accidentally orbit the sun.these are some pictures

Heres a picture of how there is no planet i can get to.

This is my rocket.again i have no way of getting home

these are just 2 pictures of my rocket/im directly above the sun D:

these kerbals will (aparently)not come back untill a later time.

get them out challenge! (for those of you who want to get them home)

Link:http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/20450-The-get-them-out-of-the-suns-orbit-Challenge-(or-the-really-long-name-challenge)?p=266032#post266032

Edited September 14, 2012 by superlauncher

Let us have a moment of silence, for our fellow Kerbonauts stranded in the abyss: Neilfrey, Ersen and Burcott.

May your brave sacrifice be a beacon for us to follow.
Alas, more are lost in the vacuum of space, we'll always remember Neilfrey, Ersen, and Burcott.
This could be the start of the greatest comedy series ever, 3 guys stranded in space. Sure there is not much for them to do but they are kerbals right? They will always find something
Yup, I'm sure that's happened to all of us at some point or another... but good practice for interplanetary travel!
I am in this exact same boat. I am working on a mission to get enough fuel into Kerbin orbit to get into a solar orbit to rescue and return!
if any of you could tell me how to get out of this...that would help
They don't look happy. Not happy at all.
Launch a rescue mission!

Precision orbital manoeuvres to align your ships for a rescue, I fear the Kraken will smite your noble rescue efforts.

Let us have a minutes silence for the three lost kerbanauts. :'(

Achieving sol orbit isn't too hard, rip the landing gear off a mun lander, rip off it's landing engines stick on a single low-thrust high ISP engine (low weight).

However adjusting your orbit will be hard as the krakan will attack your ship, possibly even rip parts off!

Edited September 11, 2012 by baked_by_oven

Your screen shots show that you've still got one and a half tanks of fuel. Why not post your persistence file in the challenges section? Someone will be able to get them home. You'll probably be surprised how quickly they'll do it.
Im sorry,What? i dont really understand.i am not very moddy (i install mods not make them) if you could explain that would be helpful.Thanks!

Im sorry,What? i dont really understand.i am not very moddy (i install mods not make them) if you could explain that would be helpful.Thanks!

Post your save file. I actually want to try getting them back.
in like 5 days they will have like this giant massive space base built from spare rocket parts, and food will be meteor dust

I have to say that I love that engine placement idea. Never occured to me.

On what did you mount the landing legs?

Edited September 13, 2012 by Awaras
If you have some fuel left you can do some adjustments of your orbit and intercept kerbin's orbit
No,dude.my goal was to make it into the muns orbit.then after i looked stuff up i figured out that i need to wait for the moon to rise.Epical failzorg on this guy

Launch a rescue mission!

I currently have 4 ships (and one jeb that got smacked into space) in the suns orbit.

Let us have a moment of silence, for our fellow Kerbonauts stranded in the abyss: Neilfrey, Ersen and Burcott.

May your brave sacrifice be a beacon for us to follow.

They will die. But on the surface of Kerbin!

You're welcome:

OHGOD

My next challenge:
